decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to apply early pressure with quick and efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf, Nimble Mongoose, and Delver of Secrets, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will, Daze, and Spell Pierce. The deck also utilizes powerful cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the right cards at the right time, while also controlling the opponent's mana base with Wasteland. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to be proactive, disruptive, and efficient in order to come out on top in the early game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a horde of powerful Merfolk creatures. Using cards like Chalice of the Void and Force of Will to control the board and protect your creatures, while Aether Vial allows you to quickly and efficiently deploy threats. True-Name Nemesis is a particularly potent threat that can be difficult for many decks to deal with. Overall, the deck aims to be aggressive and disruptive, utilizing the tribal synergy of the Merfolk creatures to dominate the battlefield.

The key theme of this deck is to control the game by utilizing lands as a resource. By quickly ramping up mana with cards like Manabond and Exploration, the deck aims to quickly establish a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port. The main win condition revolves around assembling the Dark Depths-Thespian's Stage combo to create a powerful 20/20 Marit Lage token. Additionally, cards like Life from the Loam and Punishing Fire provide value and removal options to maintain control of the game.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand, Grave Titan, and Elesh Norn, and then bringing them back onto the battlefield using spells like Reanimate and Exhume. The deck also includes cards like Careful Study and Ponder to help dig for combo pieces, along with disruption spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures while disrupting their game plan, ultimately leading to a quick victory.

The deck focuses on using a variety of control elements such as counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats of its own. By using powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil, along with versatile creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Baleful Strix, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in the long game. With a mix of efficient removal, card draw, and disruption, Grixis Control aims to control the board and grind out incremental advantages until it can secure a win.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to control the game through countering spells, drawing cards, and dealing with threats efficiently. The deck utilizes powerful control cards like Counterspell, Snapcaster Mage, Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and Terminus to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also includes card advantage engines like Accumulated Knowledge and Ponder to maintain a steady stream of resources. With a mix of removal, counterspells, and card draw, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents to secure victory in the long game.

The main concept of this Grixis Control deck is to gain tempo and card advantage through efficient removal spells, disruptive hand disruption, and powerful card draw options. By utilizing cards like Force of Will, Fatal Push, Hymn to Tourach, and Baleful Strix to control the board while using Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to generate additional value, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver opponents in a long game. The deck also includes a few threats like True-Name Nemesis and Gurmag Angler to close out games once control has been established.

The deck focuses on quickly and efficiently cheating powerful creatures into play, such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand, through cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with these massive threats before they have a chance to respond, using counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce for protection. The deck also includes card draw and manipulation spells like Ponder, Preordain, and Brainstorm to help find combo pieces and ensure consistency in executing the game plan.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage engines. The key strategy is to use cards like Force of Will, Counterspell, and Engineered Explosives to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while using cards like Predict, Brainstorm, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to draw cards and filter through the deck efficiently. The deck also includes powerful win conditions in the form of Terminus, Monastery Mentor, and Snapcaster Mage to close out the game once the opponent has been sufficiently controlled.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Gurmag Angler, and Young Pyromancer, along with disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek, Thoughtseize, and Daze to apply early pressure and control the game. The deck aims to tempo its opponents with efficient spells such as Lightning Bolt, Spell Pierce, and Force of Will while also utilizing cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm to find the necessary cards. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive strategy, with Wasteland providing additional disruption.

This deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Iona, before using cards like Animate Dead and Reanimate to bring them back onto the battlefield for a devastating combo. The key to victory lies in efficiently and effectively reanimating big threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Unmask. The deck sacrifices life total and card advantage for explosive plays and quick wins, making it a high-risk, high-reward strategy in Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

This deck is focused on quickly assembling an infect combo where creatures with infect deal damage in the form of -1/-1 counters, ultimately leading to a win with only 10 poison counters. It includes a mix of efficient infect creatures like Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf, along with powerful pump spells like Berserk and Become Immense. The deck also includes a strong mix of tempo plays and disruption spells like Daze and Force of Will to protect the combo. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, hand disruption, and removal spells. It utilizes efficient creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Vendilion Clique to apply pressure while maintaining control of the game. The synergy between cards like Bitterblossom and Spellstutter Sprite allows for incremental advantage over time. By controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's plays, the deck aims to grind out the game and emerge victorious through attrition. The Grixis Control archetype thrives on resource management and adaptability in response to various threats.

This deck focuses on generating mana quickly and playing a high number of spells in a single turn to create a large storm count. It aims to efficiently use cards like Dark Ritual, Rite of Flame, and Infernal Tutor to build up to a game-winning Ad Nauseam or Empty the Warrens. Burning Wish is used to search for specific cards from the sideboard to help with different matchups. The deck utilizes fast mana sources like Chrome Mox and Lotus Petal to power out its spells and win the game in explosive fashion.

The main focus of this deck is to control the opponent through disruption spells like Stifle, Stubborn Denial, and Daze while also utilizing powerful threats like Death's Shadow, Delver of Secrets, and Gurmag Angler to quickly close out the game. The deck aims to maintain a strong tempo advantage by utilizing efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Kolaghan's Command while also protecting its board presence with counterspells like Force of Will. By utilizing a mix of early game aggression and late game control elements, this deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on using Eldrazi creatures and powerful lands like Glimmerpost, Eye of Ugin, and Eldrazi Temple to ramp up quickly and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive threats. Cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Walking Ballista disrupt the opponent's strategy, while cards like Chalice of the Void and All Is Dust help control the board. Endbringer provides card advantage and Karn, Scion of Urza helps generate tokens and card advantage. The deck utilizes a mix of aggressive creatures, disruption, and powerful Eldrazi spells to create a strong and fast-paced gameplay.

This deck focuses on sacrificing creatures to deal damage and generate value. The key strategy is to use cards like Gravecrawler and Bloodghast to continuously bring back creatures from the graveyard, while using cards like Goblin Bombardment and Carrion Feeder to sacrifice them for various effects. The deck aims to constantly apply pressure on the opponent by creating a recurring loop of sacrificing and returning creatures. Additionally, cards like Entomb and Faithless Looting help with filling the graveyard and finding key pieces to execute the game plan effectively.

This Legacy Aggro deck focuses on playing low-cost, efficient threats like Delver of Secrets and Death's Shadow to quickly pressure the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Daze to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck maximizes its efficiency by running a low land count and cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to filter through the deck. Additionally, the inclusion of reanimation spells like Reanimate adds another angle of attack by bringing back powerful creatures for a low cost.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through removal and counterspells, while also utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Jace and Liliana. It leverages the Stoneforge Mystic package to search for equipment like Batterskull and Sword of the Meek, as well as the Thopter Foundry combo for additional value. The deck also includes versatile cards like Council's Judgment and Supreme Verdict for board control. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's blue/white/black color identity, with key lands like Karakas and Search for Azcanta to provide additional utility and card advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently cheat out powerful creatures, such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, using the card Show and Tell. By utilizing cards like Omniscience and Cunning Wish, along with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce for protection, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with game-ending threats before they can respond. The mana base is optimized for casting the combo pieces while also providing flexibility for searching with cards like Intuition. The deck is designed to be fast and disruptive, aiming to win the game in just a few turns.
